entry.title: An Ode to reunions
entry.summary:
Author: Fung1cida

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,645Chapters: 2/4Kudos: 1

Summary: She had thought, all those years, that she was just crazy. The doctors explained so. Schizophrenia tends to runs in the families. She can’t run faster than that. But if it was only that, just bad hallucinations, why did Jason die at the end? He was just another lost kid in the same street she lived at. She still lives there. If it was just mommy’s illness, why did she feel him die in her own bones? Even worse: why did she feel him come back to life? Or, Red Hood meets a probably neurotic woman obssesed with the idea she could have stopped his death. Jason Todd comes back to life and it feels like it alwats did in the begining: forceful, miserable, and confusing.

entry.title: April 27th
entry.summary:
Author: Ava_Mae

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,375Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 91

Summary: "....bad night?" you asked quietly.  He let out a harsh, almost broken laugh. "You could fuckin' say that." Oh-kay. Well that didn't sound good.  You paused and took a moment to study Jay a little more closely. He looked agitated and restless, almost on edge. His fingers were constantly tapping against his leg, and even through the mask you could tell his gaze kept bouncing around from you, down to the streets, back up to the buildings across the street, then back down to his hands; like he had too much energy and no good way to get rid of it.  "...is it something you wanna talk about?"  He shook his head, hesitated, started to nod, then shook his head again. Stopped. Gave an awkward shrug instead.  The only other time you'd ever seen him look this unsure was the time when he'd gotten dosed with fear gas. You didn't like it.

  • No Archive Warnings Apply

entry.title: Another Star in Gotham's sky (Keep shining and maybe I will see you)
entry.summary:
Author: mellewyin

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,811Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 16

Summary: “Hey, star…” Jason paused, deliberately, cautious, trying to be as controlled as never, knowing he would catch if Jason slipped his fear. “Yeah?” The boy answered, not quite paying attention, too busy washing the dishes from their last meal. Jason tries to count how many times he faced this exact scene, how many times he sat on this exact counter, eating as he saw the college student doing some domestic activity while the speaker played an old song (actually, was it jazz? was it blues? what the heck was it playing anyway?). It kind of made him hesitate more — not from discomfort, not really. It was something… something softer. Gentler even (When was the last time he felt someone being gentle with him? Jason doesn’t even need to think. He knows it was with him. Always with him.) It somehow made the things worse, made the ache on his heart hurt more, the thorns on his throat sting more. Still, he needed to ask. “Why…” Oh God, why was it so difficult? “Why you keep taking care of me?" He didn’t want to hear the answer, he already knew, and it was what he hated more.AKA civilian!reader taking care of Red Hood injuries every night <3

entry.title: Hangman's Trick // J. Todd
entry.summary:
Author: themoonunderstandsmyneeds

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,391Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 40

Summary: They were the best of friends, the girl and the boy from the slums. Hunched over books together in the library, vicious games of uno, movies and popcorn on the couch, tending to each other's scrapes and cuts, sleepovers, nights on the rooftops of Gotham, two children playing at being heroes. They never knew what awaited them, the horrors and traumas that were just a breath away. They haven't seen each other in over seven years, he's supposed to be dead, she's supposed to have moved on. But, nothing is the way it's supposed to be.   ( A/N: not the best summary but you get the point lol. don't expect this to be a comic accurate story. i will do my best to keep characters how they are represented in their media but i'm not holding myself to any particular story line. consider this an AU if you will. please check TW's. i will put chapter specific ones in the notes at the start of every chapter but for the first chapter i will try and cover all the potential triggers this story will cover. anyways, essentially this is a story where you are jason's childhood best friend, who isn't aware that he is alive. don't expect everything to make perfect sense, we will gain more backstory as we progress. enjoy xx.)

entry.title: This time I look to see what's between the lines
entry.summary:
Author: Nyxin00

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,059Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 16

Summary: You're a trouble-maker, it's in your blood. You can't help goading men twice your size into an unfair fight, knowing you always have the upper hand. There's something about seeing them go down hard, fast and with a look of shock. It makes your blood sing in your veins. Of course, the one time you get caught the court mandates anger management classes, thanks to your clear record. You'll go, if only to avoid the officer you know is chomping at the bit to kick down your door. And if you keep going for the guy you can share quiet discontent with around the coffee machine, then who's to blame you?

entry.title: The Theory of Liminal Happiness
entry.summary:
Author: i88

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,527Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 153

Summary: Jason Todd has the worst and best luck of anyone he knows. He got caught stealing Batman's tires, but then he was adopted by Bruce Wayne. Then Robin, but then Joker. Dead. Resurrected. Replaced. Red Hood. Redemption. On and on with his fucking luck until in the most ridiculous of twists he is the only person on earth who can help a young witch regain her powers after her literal demon of an ex-boyfriend stole them. All she needs from Jason is his hair, his blood, and his virginity. At least she doesn't need him to die again.

entry.title: Apartment 3B
entry.summary:
Author: ElaineInABox

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,378Chapters: 13/16Kudos: 611

Summary: You weren’t looking for love, just somewhere cheap, quiet, and safe enough to get you through the semester. Jason Todd wasn’t looking for company, just a roommate who wouldn’t ask questions about why he came home at two AM bloody and bruised.But in a cramped apartment in Crime Alley, between burnt coffee, leaky ceilings, and the soft hum of the city that never sleeps, the silence between you starts to change. What begins as survival becomes something quieter, steadier—something that almost feels like home.

entry.title: we're all reaching out to find another hand
entry.summary:
Author: soter

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 56,057Chapters: 12/18Kudos: 187

Summary: “I know you’re a meta,” you blurt. Jason stares. “What.” “I saw your hand—I saw the cut and the blood, but then, it was healed, somehow, right, and like, I know I wasn’t supposed to see that and then I felt really bad about it and I wanted to let you know that I know but I didn’t want you to think I was going to, like, blackmail you—” “Blackmail me?” “Of course not,” you quickly say. “Never. No. That’s horrible. Can you imagine what would happen if it got out?” You wince. “Sorry, stupid question, you probably have.”or in which you discover that your neighbor, Jason Todd, is a metahuman, try to compensate, and things get a little... weird.

entry.title: Attention
entry.summary:
Author: LicoricexWitch

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,788Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 141

Summary: You've always been obsessed with superheroes, ever since you were a little kid. You moved to Gotham all alone with stars in your eyes for undergrad before the cold reality of city-living set in. The streets were mean and people weren't as kind as they were back home. It was hard to make friends and you preferred to stay inside, making you even lonelier. You were a regular fish out of water, not a lot of close friends or family, living all alone--the perfect target for someone with not-so-nice intentions. They always said not to meet your heroes because they could never live up to your expectations. Or sometimes, they weren't a hero at all.
